About.title: About Oumamie
About.substanceDbDesc: Over 500 substances available for flavor creation
About.searchDbDesc: Search by CAS number, FEMA number, odor or taste. Type 'bread' and find relevant substances
About.flavorCreationDesc: Design tool to create your own flavor compositions
About.jobBoardDesc: Job search platform specialized in the flavor industry
About.aiDesc: AI assistant for flavor creation and optimization
About.quantityCalculatorDesc: Tool to calculate precise quantities per flavor: grams, liters, ppm...
About.portfolioExportDesc: Export your compositions to PDF for interviews
About.radarChartDesc: Visualization of aromatic profiles in radar chart, the cherry on top for a stylish portfolio
About.sharingDesc: Share your flavors with classmates or colleagues. They get read-only access, can duplicate to their space
About.moleculeViewerDesc: Interactive 3D molecular structure viewer with RDKit and 3Dmol integration
About.euComplianceDesc: Verify your flavor compositions against official EU FLAVIS regulations
About.contributionsDesc: Submit new substances to expand the database. Community-driven growth
About.jobAlertsDesc: Get notified when new jobs match your criteria - by location, type, or keywords
About.NewsletterDescription: Subscribe to our newsletter to follow the latest news and features
About.mainText: Oumamie is the modern platform designed for all flavor students. We noticed there was no digital tool adapted to your needs, leaving you stuck with paper tables... something that hasn't really changed in 50 years, seriously!
About.mainText2: Here, no headaches: a simple, stylish interface, and most importantly, a professional and super complete database. Our goal? To prepare you to enter the job market like pros. Like chefs in the kitchen, flavorists are hired for their skills and know-how. So instead of just saying you know how to do it, really show it with a solid portfolio from your first interviews. No need to wait until you have 10 years of experience to start building it, right?
About.mainText3: Oumamie is still brand new, we're working hard to bring you more cool features. By the way, tell us what you're missing, we're all ears!

dataCollection.title: Data Collection
dataCollection.content: We collect information that you provide directly to us, including when you create an account, use our services, or communicate with us. This may include your name, email address, and any other information you choose to provide.

dataUse.title: How We Use Your Data
dataUse.content: We use the information we collect to provide, maintain, and improve our services, to communicate with you, and to protect our rights and the rights of others.

dataSecurity.title: Data Security
dataSecurity.content: We take reasonable measures to help protect information about you from loss, theft, misuse, unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, and destruction.

cookies.title: Cookies and Similar Technologies
cookies.content: We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to track the activity on our service and hold certain information to improve and analyze our service.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at l.mangallon@gmail.com

acceptance.title: Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By accessing and using this website, you accept and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service and our Privacy Policy.

userAccounts.title: User Accounts
userAccounts.content: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials and for all activities that occur under your account.

intellectualProperty.title: Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.content: The service and its original content, features, and functionality are owned by Oumamie and are protected by international copyright, trademark, and other intellectual property laws.

userContent.title: User Content
userContent.content: By submitting content to our platform, you grant us a worldwide, non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use, reproduce, modify, and distribute that content.

termination.title: Account Termination
termination.content: We reserve the right to terminate or suspend your account and access to the service immediately, without prior notice, for any reason.

liability.title: Limitation of Liability

Workspaces.title: Workspaces
Workspaces.noWorkspacesYet: You don't have any workspaces yet. Create one to start collaborating!
Workspaces.workspacesDescription: Workspaces are collaborative spaces where you can work with your team on flavor projects. Share documents, link flavors, and collaborate in real-time.
Workspaces.featureFlavors: Link and share your flavor compositions
Workspaces.featureMembers: Invite team members with different permission levels
Workspaces.featureRoles: Control access with Owner, Editor, and Viewer roles
Workspaces.step1Description: Click 'New Workspace' to create a collaborative space. Give it a name and optional description.
Workspaces.step2Description: Add team members by email and assign roles: Owner (full control), Editor (can edit), or Viewer (read-only).
Workspaces.step3Description: Create shared documents, link flavor compositions, and work together on projects in real-time.
Workspaces.tipDescription: Use workspaces to organize projects by client, semester, or research topic. Each workspace keeps everything in one place.

Flavours.manageFlavors: Create, edit, and manage your flavor compositions
Flavours.noFlavorsFound: No flavors found matching your criteria

NewFlavour.step1Description: Give your flavor a name, select a category, and add an optional description. Choose the base unit for your concentrations.
NewFlavour.step2Description: Click 'Save Flavor' to create your formula. You'll be redirected to the detail page where you can build your composition.
NewFlavour.step3Description: Search and add substances from our database. Adjust concentrations and build your unique flavor profile.
NewFlavour.tipDescription: Start with 'Draft' status while you experiment. Once you're happy with your formula, change it to 'Published' to share it.

ImportFormulation.title: Import Formulation
ImportFormulation.uploadDescription: Upload an Excel file (.xlsx) with your formulation data. The file should follow the "Fiche de formulation" template format.

Settings.jobAlertsDescription: Get notified when new jobs match your criteria
Settings.step1Description: We check against EU Food Flavourings (~2,500 substances) and Food Additives (E-numbers) databases maintained by the European Commission.
Settings.step2Description: Substances are matched by name, synonyms, and variations. Natural extracts may not appear as EU regulates individual compounds.
Settings.step3Description: Data is fetched from the official EU datalake API and cached for 24 hours, reflecting current regulations.
Settings.tipDescription: This check is for informational purposes only. Always verify with official sources before commercial use.
Settings.extendedProfileDescription: Add more details about yourself for the community
Settings.publicProfileDescription: Make your profile visible on the community page
Settings.openToOpportunitiesDescription: Let recruiters know you're open to job offers

Calculator.title: Quantity Calculator
Calculator.description: Calculate precise quantities for your flavor formulations. Determine the right proportions of syrup, infusion, alcohol, and water to achieve your target Brix and alcohol levels.
Calculator.step1Description: Enter the Brix concentration and alcohol percentage of your syrup and infusion. These are your starting materials.
Calculator.step2Description: Set your desired final Brix and alcohol levels. Optionally add pure alcohol (96%) to fine-tune the alcohol content.
Calculator.step3Description: The calculator shows the exact quantities of each ingredient needed. The color bar visualizes the proportions at a glance.
Calculator.tipDescription: Enable 'Advanced Options' to enter ingredient prices and calculate the total cost of your preparation.
Calculator.explanationsIntro: This calculator helps you determine the masses of syrup, infusion, pure alcohol (96%) and water needed to reach your Brix and alcohol targets.
Calculator.explanationsBrix: Brix measures the sugar concentration in a solution, while the alcohol percentage indicates the strength of the infusion. Adding 96% pure alcohol allows precise adjustment of alcohol content without excessively modifying the sugar concentration.
Calculator.explanationsUnits: This calculator uses mass units (g and kg).
Calculator.explanationsAlcohol: To use pure alcohol in your formulation, adjust the 'Pure Alcohol Mass' slider in the 'Target Ratio' tab. The calculator will automatically adjust the other ingredients to maintain your targets.
Calculator.advancedOptionsDesc: Advanced options allow you to set prices per kilogram for each ingredient to calculate the total cost of your preparation.

Variations.createDescription: Create a new variation of this formula. The new variation will be a copy that you can modify independently.
Variations.noVariationsDesc: This formula doesn't have any variations yet. Create a variation first to enable comparison.
Variations.step1Description: From any formula, click '+ Variation' to create a copy. Give it a label like 'Light', 'Strong', or 'v2' to identify it.
Variations.step2Description: Each variation can have different concentrations. Use the inline sliders in comparison view to fine-tune each version.
Variations.step3Description: The radar chart overlay shows all variations at once. Quickly spot differences in flavor profiles across versions.
Variations.tipDescription: Use the variation pills at the top of any formula to quickly switch between versions while editing.

Samples.title: Sample Flavors
Samples.description: Explore example formulas. These samples demonstrate features like formula variations, allowing you to compare different versions side-by-side.
Samples.formulasWithVariationsDesc: These samples have multiple variations you can compare. Try the 'Compare Variations' feature to see how different concentrations affect the flavor profile.
Samples.noSamplesDesc: Sample flavors will appear here once they're added by the administrator.
Samples.howItWorksTitle: How to use the Variation System
Samples.step1Description: Open any formula and click the variation pills at the top to switch between versions.
Samples.step2Description: Use 'Compare Variations' to see all versions side-by-side with adjustable sliders.
Samples.step3Description: The radar chart overlay shows how flavor profiles differ across variations.
Samples.tipDescription: Create your own variations by clicking '+ Variation' on any formula you own.
Samples.faqLinkText: Learn more about sharing in the FAQ

Substances.contactModalDescription: Hey! I'm Leo, the one behind this project. If you'd like to suggest an edit for this substance, I'd love to hear from you! Feel free to reach out via WhatsApp or email - always happy to chat.

Substances.addToQueueTooltipDesc: Add this substance to your queue, then visit the Learn page to track your sensory training progress.

FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.subtitle: Everything you need to know about Oumamie
FAQ.sharingQuestion: What happens when I share a flavor?
FAQ.sharingAnswer: When you share a flavor, the recipient gets read-only access to your original composition. They can view all the details but cannot modify it. Your changes will be visible to them in real-time.
FAQ.editSharedQuestion: Can the recipient edit my flavor?
FAQ.editSharedAnswer: No, shared flavors are read-only. Only the original owner can modify the composition. This protects your work.
FAQ.duplicateQuestion: How can the recipient create their own version?
FAQ.duplicateAnswer: The recipient can duplicate the shared flavor to their personal space using the 'Duplicate' button. This creates an independent copy they can freely modify without affecting your original.
FAQ.revokeQuestion: Can I remove access after sharing?
FAQ.revokeAnswer: Yes, you can revoke access at any time from your flavor's page. The recipient will immediately lose access, but if they made a copy, that copy belongs to them.
FAQ.freeAnswer: Yes, Oumamie is completely free for all users. Our mission is to provide aspiring flavorists with the tools they need to develop their skills.
FAQ.dataAnswer: Your compositions are private by default and only visible to you. You control who you share your flavors with, and you can revoke access at any time.
FAQ.regulatoryDataQuestion: Where does the regulatory data come from?
FAQ.regulatoryDataAnswer: All EU regulatory data is sourced directly from the official EU FLAVIS database maintained by the European Commission. This ensures you always have access to accurate and up-to-date information about flavouring substance regulations in the European Union.
FAQ.additiveVsFlavouringQuestion: What is the difference between additives and flavourings in regulations?
FAQ.additiveVsFlavouringAnswer: The same molecule can be classified either as an additive or as a flavouring substance, and this classification determines which regulation applies. Our database draws from two sources: the additives list and the flavourings list. This distinction is crucial for flavorists, as choosing whether to use a substance as an additive or a flavouring has significant regulatory implications. Understanding these differences is essential for making informed decisions in flavor formulation.
FAQ.contributeSubstanceQuestion: How can I contribute new substances?
FAQ.contributeSubstanceAnswer: You can submit new substances through the Contribute page. You'll need to provide the substance name, at least one identifier (CAS number, FEMA number, or PubChem ID), and at least one sensory property (odor, taste, or flavor profile). Your submission will be available immediately in your own flavors while awaiting verification.
FAQ.feedbackQuestion: How can I report errors or suggest improvements?
FAQ.feedbackAnswer: On any substance page, you can submit feedback to report errors, request changes, or suggest data enhancements. Choose the feedback type, specify which field needs attention, and provide your suggested correction along with a source reference if available.
FAQ.contributionProcessQuestion: What happens after I submit a contribution?
FAQ.contributionProcessAnswer: New substance submissions start with 'User Entry' status and can be used immediately in your flavors. Our team reviews submissions and may verify them for the entire community. You can track the status of your contributions and edit unverified submissions at any time.
FAQ.importQuestion: How can I import my existing formulations?
FAQ.importAnswerBase: You can import formulations from Excel files (.xlsx) following the 'Fiche de formulation' template format. Go to My Flavors, click 'Import', and upload your file. The system will parse your spreadsheet, match ingredients to our substance database using fuzzy matching, and create a new flavor with all your data. You can preview matches before importing and adjust the matching threshold if needed. If you'd like to import from a different format or source, contact me at
FAQ.importAnswerEnd: and I'll do my best to help.
FAQ.importWhatsAppMessage: Hi Leo, I'd like to discuss importing my formulations from a different format.

Learn.title: Flavor Learning
Learn.subtitle: Master sensory identification of flavor substances
Learn.signInDescription: Please sign in to access the learning features.
Learn.queuePageDescription: Manage substances you want to learn
Learn.searchSubstances: Search for substances to add to your learning queue
Learn.noReviewsDue: No reviews due! You're all caught up.
Learn.substanceNotFoundDescription: This substance doesn't exist or you don't have access.
Learn.sensoryDescription: Confirm you have experienced this substance
Learn.flavorExperience: I can identify this in food/drinks
Learn.sensoryRequired: You must smell and taste this substance before advancing your mastery level.
Learn.unlockAdvanced: Complete sensory experience to unlock advanced statuses
Learn.notesDescription: Record your personal observations and associations
Learn.notesPlaceholder: Write your observations, impressions, and notes about this substance...
Learn.associationsPlaceholder: What does this remind you of?
Learn.descriptorsPlaceholder: Enter descriptors separated by commas (e.g., fruity, sweet, vanilla-like)
Learn.descriptorsHelp: Separate each descriptor with a comma
Learn.notStartedDesc: You haven't started learning this substance yet
Learn.learningDesc: You're actively learning to identify this substance
Learn.confidentDesc: You can reliably identify this substance
Learn.masteredDesc: You've mastered the identification of this substance
Learn.addToQueueFirst: Add this substance to your queue to start learning
Learn.step1Description: Browse substances and add the ones you want to learn to your queue. Start with common aroma chemicals.
Learn.step2Description: Smell and taste each substance. Check off your sensory experiences and add personal notes to remember key characteristics.
Learn.step3Description: Progress through levels: Learning → Confident → Mastered. Spaced repetition reviews help you retain what you've learned.
Learn.tipDescription: Keep a physical kit of aroma chemicals nearby. The best way to learn is by experiencing the real thing while studying the data.

Onboarding.welcomeSubtitle: You've joined a community of flavor scientists, students, and enthusiasts.
Onboarding.welcomeBody: Let's take a quick tour of the key features.
Onboarding.featureFormulasDesc: Build professional flavor formulas with our intuitive editor.
Onboarding.featureFormulasHighlight2: Create variations to compare different versions
Onboarding.featureFormulasHighlight3: Visualize your formula with interactive charts
Onboarding.featureLearningDesc: Master your aromatic palette with our learning system.
Onboarding.featureLearningHighlight1: Train your nose with guided tasting sessions
Onboarding.featureLearningHighlight2: Track progress with streaks and achievements
Onboarding.featureLearningHighlight3: Spaced repetition to reinforce your memory
Onboarding.featureWorkspacesDesc: Work together with your team on shared projects.
Onboarding.featureWorkspacesHighlight1: Organize formulas and documents in projects
Onboarding.featureWorkspacesHighlight3: Invite team members with different roles
Onboarding.completeSubtitle: Here's what you can do to get started:

Facts.ald-001: Acetaldehyde brings ethereal and green apple notes, commonly used in fruit and alcohol flavors.
Facts.ald-002: Hexanal is responsible for the freshly cut grass smell in green flavors.
Facts.ald-003: (E)-2-Hexenal gives the characteristic note of green tomato leaf.
Facts.ald-009: Vanillin represents 1-2% of the dry weight of a vanilla bean.
Facts.est-002: Isoamyl acetate is the signature molecule of banana and candy flavor.
Facts.est-007: Methyl anthranilate is responsible for the characteristic Concord grape aroma.
Facts.lac-001: γ-Decalactone is the iconic molecule of peach aroma.
Facts.lac-006: Sotolon has a powerful smell of curry, fenugreek, and burnt caramel.
Facts.lac-008: Ethyl maltol is 6 times more powerful than maltol with a cotton candy note.
Facts.ket-001: Diacetyl is the main compound of fresh butter taste.
Facts.ket-006: β-Damascenone has an extremely low perception threshold (0.002 ppb) with rose and cooked apple notes.
Facts.ket-009: L-Carvone smells like spearmint while D-carvone smells like caraway.
Facts.alc-004: Menthol activates the TRPM8 receptor, creating a cold sensation.
Facts.alc-005: cis-3-Hexenol is the molecule of freshly cut grass.
Facts.pyr-001: 2-Isobutyl-3-methoxypyrazine has the lowest known perception threshold (0.002 ppb) with an intense green bell pepper smell.
Facts.thi-003: Furfurylthiol is the impact compound of roasted coffee with a threshold of 0.01 ppb.
Facts.thi-004: Methional gives the characteristic smell of cooked potato.
Facts.fur-001: Furaneol (HDMF) is the key compound of ripe strawberry aroma with caramel notes.
Facts.ter-001: Limonene makes up to 90% of orange essential oil.
Facts.ter-002: D-Limonene smells like orange while L-limonene smells like lemon.
Facts.ter-014: Nootkatone is responsible for the characteristic grapefruit aroma.
Facts.pro-001: A typical strawberry aroma combines furaneol for ripe character, γ-decalactone for fruitiness, and cis-3-hexenol for green freshness.
Facts.pro-003: Ethylvanillin is 3-4 times more powerful than natural vanillin.
Facts.pro-009: The classic buttery accord combines diacetyl, acetoin, and δ-decalactone for a complete creamy profile.
Facts.pro-013: The difference between peppermint and spearmint comes from menthol vs carvone.
Facts.thr-001: 2-Isobutyl-3-methoxypyrazine (green bell pepper) has a threshold of 0.002 ppb, the lowest known.
Facts.thr-006: β-Ionone (violet) is detectable at 0.007 ppb, explaining the power of this note.
Facts.mai-001: The Maillard reaction between sugars and amino acids produces cooking, grilled, and roasted aromas.
Facts.chi-001: Chirality can completely change a molecule's smell: L-carvone smells like spearmint, D-carvone smells like caraway.
Facts.for-004: Start a formulation with 3-5 ingredients to establish the aroma skeleton.
Facts.for-005: An aroma should always be tested in its final application as the support modifies perception.
Facts.for-007: The classic buttery accord: diacetyl + acetoin + δ-decalactone.
Facts.for-008: The ripe strawberry accord: furaneol + γ-decalactone + cis-3-hexenol.
Facts.enh-001: Maltol enhances sweet perception at dosages of 50-200 ppm.
Facts.enh-002: Ethyl maltol is 6 times more effective than maltol for enhancing sweetness.
Facts.sta-002: Citral cyclizes in acidic conditions, losing its characteristic lemon note.
Facts.reg-001: A natural flavor 'of X' must contain at least 95% of its flavoring part from source X.
Facts.tas-001: Sweet is detected by T1R2+T1R3 receptors on the tongue.
Facts.tas-006: Capsaicin from chili activates the TRPV1 receptor, creating the heat/burning sensation.
Facts.cui-002: Tarragon is the essential herb of béarnaise sauce.
Facts.cui-004: Fenugreek gives curry its distinctive sweet-bitter note thanks to sotolon.
Facts.ind-001: Givaudan (Switzerland) is the world leader in the flavors and fragrances industry.
Facts.ind-005: Mane (France) is the largest family-owned flavor house in the world.
